MC	<table border="0" style="border: 0px solid white; border-collapse: collapse; "> <tr><td> <table border=1 style="border: 1px solid black; border-collapse: collapse; "><colgroup width="60"></colgroup> <colgroup width="60"></colgroup> <colgroup width="80"></colgroup> <colgroup width="80"></colgroup> <colgroup width="80"></colgroup> <colgroup width="80"></colgroup> <tr> <th align='center' colspan='2' rowspan='2' style='background-color: lightgray; vertical-align: middle;'>Dihybrid<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='4'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ER</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Er</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eR</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>er</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ER</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>EERR</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>EERr</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>EeRR</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>EeRr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Er</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>EERr</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: plum;'>EErr</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>EeRr</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: plum;'>Eerr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eR</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>EeRR</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>EeRr</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightsalmon;'>eeRR</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightsalmon;'>eeRr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>er</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>EeRr</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: plum;'>Eerr</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightsalmon;'>eeRr</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: snow;'>eerr</td></tr></table> </td><td> &nbsp; </td><td> <table border=1 style="border: 1px solid black; border-collapse: collapse; "><colgroup width="60"></colgroup> <colgroup width="60"></colgroup> <colgroup width="80"></colgroup> <tr> <th align='center' colspan='2' rowspan='2' style='background-color: lightgray; vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>er</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ER</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>EeRr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Er</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: plum;'>Eerr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eR</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightsalmon;'>eeRr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>er</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: snow;'>eerr</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were nine to three to three to one (9:3:3:1).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect

The phenotypes were nine to three to three to one (9:3:3:1).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eg</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>EG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: ivory;'>EeGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Eg</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: yellow;'>Eegg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: palegreen;'>eeGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eg</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: cornflowerblue;'>eegg</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were nine to three to three to one (9:3:3:1).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect

The phenotypes were nine to three to three to one (9:3:3:1).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect

The phenotypes were nine to three to three to one (9:3:3:1).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Correct

vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ag</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>AG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: yellow;'>AaGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Ag</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: goldenrod;'>Aagg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>aG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: sienna;'>aaGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ag</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: sienna;'>aagg</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were nine to three to four (9:3:4).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect

vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>er</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ER</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>EeRr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Er</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: goldenrod;'>Eerr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eR</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: snow;'>eeRr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>er</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: snow;'>eerr</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were nine to three to four (9:3:4).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect

When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect

vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>dg</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>DG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: cornflowerblue;'>DdGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Dg</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: cornflowerblue;'>Ddgg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>dG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: aquamarine;'>ddGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>dg</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: azure;'>ddgg</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were twelve to three to one (12:3:1).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect

vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ar</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>AR</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: sienna;'>AaRr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Ar</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: sienna;'>Aarr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>aR</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: goldenrod;'>aaRr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ar</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: yellow;'>aarr</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were twelve to three to one (12:3:1).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect

When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Correct

</td><td> <table border=1 style="border: 1px solid black; border-collapse: collapse; "><colgroup width="60"></colgroup> <colgroup width="60"></colgroup> <colgroup width="80"></colgroup> <tr> <th align='center' colspan='2' rowspan='2' style='background-color: lightgray; vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ag</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>AG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: cornflowerblue;'>AaGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Ag</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: ivory;'>Aagg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>aG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: ivory;'>aaGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ag</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: ivory;'>aagg</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were nine to seven (9:7).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect

When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>dg</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>DG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: yellow;'>DdGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Dg</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: sienna;'>Ddgg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>dG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: sienna;'>ddGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>dg</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: sienna;'>ddgg</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were nine to seven (9:7).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect

The phenotypes were nine to seven (9:7).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect

vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>at</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>AT</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: cornflowerblue;'>AaTt</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>At</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: lime;'>Aatt</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>aT</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: lime;'>aaTt</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>at</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: azure;'>aatt</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were nine to six to one (9:6:1).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect

When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect

vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eg</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>EG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: ivory;'>EeGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Eg</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: yellow;'>Eegg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: yellow;'>eeGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eg</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: cornflowerblue;'>eegg</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were nine to six to one (9:6:1).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect

The phenotypes were fifteen to one (15:1).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect

vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>et</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ET</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>EeTt</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Et</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>Eett</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eT</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>eeTt</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>et</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: snow;'>eett</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were fifteen to one (15:1).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect

When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect

vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>er</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ER</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: cornflowerblue;'>EeRr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Er</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: cornflowerblue;'>Eerr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eR</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: aquamarine;'>eeRr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>er</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: cornflowerblue;'>eerr</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were thirteen to three (13:3).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect

When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect

vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eg</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>EG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>EeGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Eg</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>Eegg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: yellow;'>eeGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eg</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>eegg</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were thirteen to three (13:3).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect

When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect

vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ar</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>AR</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: yellow;'>AaRr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Ar</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: goldenrod;'>Aarr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>aR</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>aaRr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ar</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: sienna;'>aarr</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were nine to three to three to one (9:3:3:1).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect

When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Correct

</td><td> <table border=1 style="border: 1px solid black; border-collapse: collapse; "><colgroup width="60"></colgroup> <colgroup width="60"></colgroup> <colgroup width="80"></colgroup> <tr> <th align='center' colspan='2' rowspan='2' style='background-color: lightgray; vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>at</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>AT</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: azure;'>AaTt</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>At</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: aquamarine;'>Aatt</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>aT</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: cornflowerblue;'>aaTt</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>at</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: cornflowerblue;'>aatt</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were nine to three to four (9:3:4).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect

vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ae</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>AE</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: snow;'>AaEe</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Ae</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: pink;'>Aaee</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>aE</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>aaEe</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ae</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>aaee</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were nine to three to four (9:3:4).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect

When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Correct

vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ae</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>AE</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: ivory;'>AaEe</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Ae</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: ivory;'>Aaee</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>aE</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: palegreen;'>aaEe</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ae</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: cornflowerblue;'>aaee</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were twelve to three to one (12:3:1).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect

vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eg</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>EG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>EeGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Eg</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>Eegg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightsalmon;'>eeGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>eg</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: snow;'>eegg</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were twelve to three to one (12:3:1).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect

When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ag</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>AG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>AaGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Ag</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: snow;'>Aagg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>aG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: snow;'>aaGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ag</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: snow;'>aagg</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were nine to seven (9:7).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect

Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect

vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>dg</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>DG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: sienna;'>DdGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Dg</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: yellow;'>Ddgg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>dG</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: yellow;'>ddGg</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>dg</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: yellow;'>ddgg</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were nine to seven (9:7).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect

Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect

vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>gt</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>GT</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: snow;'>GgTt</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Gt</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightsalmon;'>Ggtt</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>gT</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightsalmon;'>ggTt</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>gt</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: tomato;'>ggtt</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were nine to six to one (9:6:1).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect

When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect

vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ar</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>AR</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: ivory;'>AaRr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>Ar</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: ivory;'>Aarr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>aR</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: ivory;'>aaRr</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>ar</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: cornflowerblue;'>aarr</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were fifteen to one (15:1).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect

When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. The phenotypes were thirteen to three (13:3).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Correct	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect

When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Correct

vertical-align: middle;'>Test<br/>Cross</th>  <th align='center' colspan='1'>Female &female;</th> </tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>de</td></tr><tr> <th align='center' rowspan='4' style='vertical-align: middle;'>Male<br/>&male;</th>  <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>DE</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: cornflowerblue;'>DdEe</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>De</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: cornflowerblue;'>Ddee</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>dE</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: aquamarine;'>ddEe</td></tr><tr> <td align='center' style='background-color: lightgray'>de</td> <td align='center' style='background-color: cornflowerblue;'>ddee</td></tr></table></td></tr></table>  <br/> <p>Above are the phenotypic results from a dihybrid cross and double heterozygote test cross. The phenotypes were thirteen to three (13:3).</p><p><strong>What type of gene interaction is being shown?</strong></p>	These two genes show <strong>duplicate dominant epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it shows the same phenotype.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate interaction epistasis</strong>. When either gene is dominant, it hides the effects of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>digenic inheritance</strong>. Interaction of two genes affect the phenotypic expression of a single trait.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant, it hides the phenotype of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>duplicate recessive epistasis</strong>. When either gene is homozygous recessive, it hides the effect of the other gene.	Incorrect	These two genes show <strong>dominant and recessive epistasis</strong>. When one gene is dominant and another gene is homozygous recessive, it creates a new phenotype.	Correct
